item.title: How to install a CS GO (Counter-Strike: Global Offensive) server in Ubuntu 20.10
item.description: Some people are interested in have a private server in order to play CS GO (Counter-Strike: Global Offensive) with their friends. The process is easy to follow. What is needed? A server Memory: At least 2GB RAM (I recommend 4GB) Disk: At least 15 GB os disk space CPU architecture: x86 (ARM not supported) A Valve account Create a new user First of all, it is important to create a new user in Linux in order to prevent CS GO server possible hacking to affect your Linux node.

item.title: Solve issue "client intended to send too large body" in Nginx
